page.title: 07 Schools in 1985.
page.content: A survey was made of 8 schools.The object of the survey was to find out roughly how many pupils were in each school in the area and what the age of the school was. The school with the most pupils was the{Sir William {Nottidge}with 1000 pupils.{Westmeads {Infants}had the least with 122 pupils. {Endowed C of E.}is oldest,being 141 years old.{Joy Lane Junior}is the youngest it is 14.When{St.Marys}was opened it was a convent and private school.The 1st school was first run by Thomas Tuddenham in Middle Wall. The{County Primary}was called The Whitstable Boys Council School.It was a board school.{The Endowed School}was the girls school in the area and is a Church Aided School.{St.Alphege}is a Church School.{St.Vincents}is for boys with problems.Selective pupils travel to Faversham & Canterbury.
